code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
	<meta charset="utf-8">
	<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1, shrink-to-fit=no">
	<meta name="theme-color" content="#000000">
	<!--
      manifest.json provides metadata used when your web app is added to the
      homescreen on Android. See https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/engage-and-retain/web-app-manifest/
    -->
	<link rel="manifest" href="%PUBLIC_URL%/manifest.json">
	<link rel="shortcut icon" href="%PUBLIC_URL%/favicon.ico">
	<!--
      Notice the use of %PUBLIC_URL% in the tags above.
      It will be replaced with the URL of the `public` folder during the build.
      Only files inside the `public` folder can be referenced from the HTML.

      Unlike "/favicon.ico" or "favicon.ico", "%PUBLIC_URL%/favicon.ico" will
      work correctly both with client-side routing and a non-root public URL.
      Learn how to configure a non-root public URL by running `npm run build`.
    -->
	<title>React App</title>
</head>
explanation:
This block is the HTML header of a web page, specifying metadata and linking external files, including:

* Character encoding
* Viewport settings for responsive design
* Theme color for Android home screen integration
* Manifest file (for PWA functionality)
* Favicon icon

Its purpose is to provide essential information about the web page.

explanation:
Here is a concise summary of the purpose and functionality of this block:

**Purpose:** A React app that uses Magic, a JavaScript library for authentication and payments, to enable users to log in with an email address and send NEAR cryptocurrency to a destination address.

**Functionality:**

* Retrieves user login status via Magic
* Stores user's public address, destination address, send amount, and transaction hash
* Allows user to send NEAR transactions using the NearExtension and near-api-js libraries
* Displays real-time sending transaction status

file_summary:
Here's a holistic summary of the file 'src/App.js':

**Purpose:** This React app enables users to log in with an email address, display their public Near account ID, and send NEAR cryptocurrency transactions using Magic Auth and the Near blockchain.

**Functionality:**

* Handles user authentication and transaction management
* Displays real-time sending transaction status and logs signed transactions to the console
* Provides login, logout, and sign transaction functions
* Allows users to send NEAR transactions with a destination address and amount

explanation:
Here is a concise summary of the purpose and functionality of this block:

**Functionality Summary**

This code block handles user authentication and Near blockchain transactions.

* It checks if the user is logged in (`isLoggedIn`) and updates public address and metadata accordingly.
* It provides login, logout, and sign transaction functions using Magic Auth and Near blockchain.
* The `handleSignTransaction` function creates a transfer transaction and signs it with the user's private key.

explanation:
Here is a concise summary of the purpose and functionality of this block:

**Purpose:** This code handles the result of a signed transaction, logs it to the console, and renders a login/signup page or displays user metadata if logged in.

**Functionality:**

* Decodes a signed transaction from a buffer.
* Logs the decoded transaction to the console.
* Displays a login/signup form if not logged in (with input field and submit button).
* Displays user email and logout button if logged in.

explanation:
Here is a summary of the block's purpose and functionality:

**Purpose:** Display Near account ID and allow user to sign and send transactions.

**Functionality:**

* Displays public address (account ID) in an "info" div.
* Provides button to sign a transaction, with status indicators:
	+ Success: displays signed transaction hash and success message.
	+ Signing in progress: displays "Signing transaction" text.
	+ Not signing: displays empty state.
